name: Runner LXC Rd 4
Corp LXC Rd 4
Stealthy Ghosts
description:
I wanted a stealth deck so this is what I came up with. Scheherazade will save you memory while you put cloaks on there and maybe your magnum opus on there.

I have dinosaurus as well to save 1 MU for you overmind and make your stealthy code gate or sentry breaker viable of running into those crazy jinteki code gates/sentries they have going on. Corroder because it's still the best beaker for the runners.

All the hardware should be very cheap to install. With the exception of dinosaurus, hardware is all at cost 1.

Stealth cards look super fun. Black cat might be a barrier breaker to consider. getting through servers should be pretty easy as long as you stay up on Magnum opus money spend your stealth credits wisely.

You'll have to wait a while before all these cards get printed.

name: In Soviet Russia, Ice Breaks You - LXC4
description:
Banned cards:

Agenda

  • Accelerated Beta Test (3)
  • AstroScript Pilot Program (2)
  • Hostile Takeover (1)
  • NAPD Contract (2)
  • Priority Requisition (1)
  • Project Vitruvius (3)

Asset

  • Adonis Campaign (3)
  • Jackson Howard (1)
  • Melange Mining Corp (2)
  • PAD Campaign (1)
  • Shock! (2)
  • Snare! (3)

ICE

  • Eli 1.0 (2)
  • Enigma (1)
  • Ice Wall (2)
  • Inazuma (3)
  • Tollbooth (1)
  • Wall of Static (3)

Operation

  • Beanstalk Royalties (3)
  • Celebrity Gift (3)
  • Hedge Fund (1)
  • Scorched Earth (2)
  • Subliminal Messaging (2)
  • Sweeps Week (1)

Upgrade

  • Amazon Industrial Zone (2)
  • Ash 2X3ZB9CY (1)
  • Caprice Nisei (3)
  • Hokusai Grid (2)
  • Red Herrings (3)
  • SanSan City Grid (1)

name: A Whizzard Did It
All Hail Queen Reina
ETFA OR GTFO
description: Made for a siphon heavy world, but capable of beating control decks as well.

name: A Gentleman Never Runs
description:
A blackmail deck. It needs the triple combo of Activist Support, New Angeles City Hall (to burn the tag), and Aesop's (to deactivate Activist Support), but Iain Sterling's ability makes the long game viable and Logos can tutor up missing pieces.

With The Source on the table and plentiful expose options, the Corp can't put any agendas down when you're set up or you'll just waltz in and take them. You can sneakdoor in if they're hoarding in HQ (with legwork), while Femmes help with Oversighted ice.

This isn't competitive, but it is dripping with theme. You feel like an imperious old spy once everything is together.

name: Person of Interest
description:
The original design was to use Snoop, Invasion of Privacy and Data Hound to mess with the runner's tempo by sniping key cards, but this didn't work too well in practice.

It ended up as more of a tax deck. Playing Closed Accounts then rezzing City Surveillance is a pretty nasty combo. I have to stand up for Data Hound, which gets readily mocked on BGG, but which has been a real star. People will blithely run through it and let you kill early econ or breakers and slow up their stack.

While this looks sloppy (1 Psychographics and Beale?), it has won most of its games in my meta and it's nice to play something NBN that isn't Fast Advance.

name: Harmony's Revolving Door
description:
Messing with Mushin No Shin, the Harmony Medtech ID and 3 point agendas to rush a scoring win before the runner gets enough on the table.

Mirrormorph, Anonymous Tip, Fast Track and a scored executive retreat help with the rush, while everything (bar rezzing Guard) works with minimal economy.

A massive gamble deck. But fun.

name: A Whizzard Wheeze
description:
The first deck I ever built when I didn't know my arse from my elbow. The idea was to draw through and set up a rig as soon as possible using Wyldside and Quality Times, then reset with Levy.

There's plenty of economy, and using Dinosaurus and Personal Touches with Ice Carver on the Anarchist breaker suite (esp Morningstar) gives you a rig that can bust down doors for cheap. Vamp helps set back the Corp tempo. I've always found it to be a massively underrated card.

I'd probably tweak this a lot now, but it did win a good share of games in it's time, despite how bloated it is.

name: Macguyver
description:
I was quite proud of my Exile deck until I looked around and realised it was almost exactly the same as the Dirty Hands deck. ;_;

It is awesome, but awkward to pilot. Tutor up Magnum Opus (I would have 3 if I had another core set), run a lot, overdraw and burn through your stack to turn your heap into a tutor pit, Test Run and Scavenge combo to get out Femme Fatale, and constantly recurse Deus Ex to make all Jinteki decks cry.

This version is messing around with Feedback Filter (because I kept faceplanting into Overwriters) and Disrupter (because I got Midseasoned) and Gingerbread because I want to test it, but I wouldn't ordinarily put those cards in.

name: Guard Silhouette
description: Run only on centrals, access cards in remote with Quest Completed.

name: The Quiet Refinery
Keymaster
description:
In general this deck is looking to get out Magnum Opus and a code gate breaker asap. Once those are out with a Knight it becomes really easy to bully the corp. Escher is extremely strong here, as are Nerve Agent and (hopefully) Vamp. If the corp is just gaining money waiting for you to pull the trigger and fall into their traps, you can outpace them, then go for a Vamp run and suck them dry. And that should usually pull you out ahead.

I'm playing around with False Echo as a way to force the corp to rez ice and keep them poor. If they don't respect FE you can remove the ice and open up a great window for one of the power event cards. If they do rez it, it's a 1 credit 1 click to card slot investment. Levy AR Lab Access is in there to recur events and in case of disasters, but it could probably be taken out and replaced with something else.

name: Demolition Man
Pinch in the Eye
Andromeda Toolbox v4
Demolition Man
Upgrades Galore
description:
Basic combo: Psychic Field + SanSan

Flatline potential: House of Knives + Troubleshot/Inazumaed Katana/Tsurugi + Hokusai (this deck doesn't rely on the flatline though! Use net damage to slow the Runner)

Probably can't afford to set up a scoring remote - HQ and R&D protection is IMPORTANT!

Future Perfect should ideally not be scored; instead chuck into Archives/reshuffle with Jackson/keep in hand. This leaves 11 agenda points, of which you need 7 to fast advance to win.

name: INDUSTRIAL-ICED (AKTUELL)
Iceless Jinteki
description: Constantly install and advance different assets, let the runner run and impale themself on your servers over and over.

name: Tag, Bag & Fast Advance
description:
This is still theoretical so any ideas are welcome the idea is as the name implies a tag & bag deck that can also fast advance.

Id like to put biotic labor in the deck but i am unsure weather the econ will work if i make room for it. San-San is also an idea but then the tag & bag side would suffer for it.

name: CT's Toybox
description:
This deck is fun to play, and so far wins more than half the time barring mistakes.

There are 9 cards that say "Magnum Opus" (MO, Test Run, SMC) and you need to have access to one from turn 1. You don't have to play it though, often I will just run every click until the middle of turn 2 or 3, potentially spending some clicks to recover from NAPD, before forcing out the rig. Never do this against Jinteki, since you can't afford to lose the MO in your starting hand.

There's no server I can't get into with MO + SMC + Clone Chip, and that's really the secret to this deck. Never build more of the rig than you need. Try to run at least once every turn. With Deus X and Sharpshooter in your stack (or heap with clone chip) there is no ice that can hurt you, and if you're worried about traps just jack out after you force the corp to rez ice. Once MO is out, Sharpshooter allows you to be incredibly aggressive while you wait for them to make you get a rig. By this time you've scored 1-4 points and trashed some of their economy. Don't be afraid to spend a turn clicking for 8 credits, but time it so that you do this right after the corp has spent their turn clicking for 3. That happens a lot with this deck.

Personal Workshop makes Quality Time viable and provides that little bit of extra economy to take the edge off the slowness of MO.

Nerve agent is mostly there to spread ice out. If they go heavy on HQ start Indexing, vice versa with R&D.

Try to always Dino the Fem, but don't be afraid to put it down on your rig and Scavenge it later. Final rig is Dino-Fem, MO, Corroder, Torch, and whichever utility program you need most. Against Jinteki it's Deus X, against Weyland and NBN it's usually Imp to kill the scorched combo pieces from hand, against HB it's an Imp that often gets trashed for Deus X to break Heimdall x.0 cheaply, but I've also brought out the second Fem on the one occasion when HB got enough money together to rez a Janus.

name: Wild Wild West
description:
Reina-rado and her trusty steed Wyrm.

This is a basic Reina+Desperado build with an added twist in the form of Wyrm that I'm testing out. The idea is to credit up and install steadily with conventional breakers but making sure to run enough to force rezzes on important servers. Once a prime server is rezzed and prepped for attack, install parasite on a predetermined ICE marked for death and install Wyrm for a surprise destruction run. Instead of dealing with annoying ICE, destroy them from the field and pave a path for multi-access runs with Medium and Nerve Agent.

name: Meat Damage
description:
No matter what you do, you're taking meat damage. Thats the goal here. Seeing if I can make the Data Raven / Dedicated Response Team 'combo' work out.

Levy! (I know right) Its here to get Data Raven. Mulligan for it or a raven (probably). Best case you can grab two ravens with it, but even just getting one before they trash is fine. Think of it like a double that tutors for ice.

Interns keeps Dedicated in play as much as possible.

I picture a slow game where the threat of dmg and the dmg itself keeps the runner a at slow pace. Hopefully you're able to snipe important rig pieces either through destroyers or dmg. The threat of scorched should also force them to clear tags and a surprise snare can set up a win (or at least a plascrete-clearing turn).

name: Harmony M3dt3ch
Soak up the Sun
description:
I wanted to give the Blue Sun identity a try, and came up with this.This deck is focused on meat damage for the kill.

Amazon Industrial zone is used to rez ice at a discount so it can then be pulled back into HQ for credits each turn. Alternately, I am hoping to Oversight AI a Curtain Wall or Hadrian's Wall and get a net of 9+ credits.

Cerebral Cast is used to scare the runner into taking a brain damage or risk a scorched (which a real threat).

If the runner does manage to steal an agenda, Punitive Counterstrike is there to make them regret it. In the right circumstance Punitive + Private Security Force could be enough to win the game.

Data Raven, Draco, and Shadow are all used to keep the runner scared of getting tagged for the same reason. Draco and Shadow were chosen because they can be pumped high enough that it becomes expensive for the runner to break the subroutine, which allows the trace option.

Swordsman is to deal with Overmind/Atman decks. Of limited use beyond that, but cheap to rez and potentially fodder for the identity ability.

name: Oslo Regional 4th Place Taxing Medtech
description: Published primarily to send to TO. The deck works roughly the way you think it should.

name: Oslo Regional 4th Place TagMe Reina
description: Published primarily to send to TO. Pretty standard Anarch Account Siphon TagMe.

name: Jinteki - Come and Get it
description:
This is my first deck to publish on here and pretty much my first Jinteki...what can I say I'm a noob.

Anyway, here is the idea behind the deck...NO ICE!!!

I have been wanting to try out the Shell Game since reading about it and the concept seemed absolutely absurd to me, but at the same time SUPER FUN! I would just put out as many assets as possible each turn, advancing here and there depending on the situation and of course having the runner screw himself over if he hits the wrong server or if he decides to play safe and only run R&D, scoring all the tasty agenda points the very next turn. The one big problem I could see this deck facing is money. Kinteki generally doesn't have endless funds to play with, but I fill there is even more of a lack of income here because of the reduced operations. I do have some money makers in there that double as funds denial for others if they do trash them due to being higher on the trash cost side, but criminal decks would probably just laugh at my measly 4-5 trash costs and destroy all the servers.

Any advice/criticism/slaps in the face are welcome! Thanks

name: Meat Damage v2
description:
No matter what you do, you're taking meat damage. Thats the goal here. Seeing if I can make the Data Raven / Dedicated Response Team 'combo' work out.

Levy! (I know right) Its here to get Data Raven. Mulligan for it or a raven (probably). Best case you can grab two ravens with it, but even just getting one before they trash is fine. Think of it like a double that tutors for ice.

Interns keeps Dedicated in play as much as possible.

I picture a slow game where the threat of dmg and the dmg itself keeps the runner a at slow pace. Hopefully you're able to snipe important rig pieces either through destroyers or dmg. The threat of scorched should also force them to clear tags and a surprise snare can set up a win (or at least a plascrete-clearing turn).

name: Teach Me How to Duggar!
description: Duggars was made for Caissa. Duggars as fast as possible, discard your programs. Install deep red, then recur your parasites and Caissa until the Corp is battered and broken. Levy if you need to get more parasite recursion for some reason, or against jinteki.
